DIAS Archive

This site hosts the practical, open-source investigation component of our Master's thesis. It traces biometric voice technologies in European asylum procedures.

The Archive documents how the Dialect Identification Assistance System (DIAS) and related voice-based systems shape borders, credibility assessments, and the lives of people seeking protection.

Figures & Statistics Use Cases More on Voice Biometrics

What is DIAS?

DIAS is a voice-based tool used to classify the “dialect” of asylum seekers. It turns spoken language into data points that are used in credibility assessments, shaping decisions about who is believed and who is not.

Detailed information on DIAS

How DIAS is used

Follow how DIAS appears in asylum interviews, language assessments, and credibility evaluations, and how its outcomes travel through administrative and legal processes.

Method overview

Risks & critiques

Learn about technical limitations, political stakes, and human rights concerns surrounding voice-based decision systems at the border.
